instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: This computer gets slow and the fan starts turning, I ran asd os and the following error appears TC0D CPU 0 Die analog, any suggestions

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
CPU die temperature sensor is embedded into CPU.
You can check <CHIP>U5510</CHIP> solders and traces for pins 2 & 3.

Run HWMonitor and check all temps reported.

Just in case, remove/replace <CAPACITOR>C5511</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I don't see bad solders <CHIP>U5510</CHIP>, nor bad traces pin 2 and pin 3, replace <CAPACITOR>C5511</CAPACITOR> persist problem this hwmonitor

[ATTACH type="full"]61258[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
The problem may be CPU itself.

Just in case, change <CHIP>U5510</CHIP>...
